itemDescription: British actress; daughter of Miles Fitzalan-Howard, 17th Duke of Norfolk, and Anne Constable-Maxwell

wikipedia_page.main: Lady Marcia Mary Josephine Fitzalan-Howard (born 10 March 1953), known as Marsha Fitzalan, is an English actress.

He has a brother, Lord Gerald, and three sisters, including the actress Marsha Fitzalan.

* Adventure Four written by Julian Bond, in eight parts. Dandy Parkes (Terence Seward), a middle-aged playboy and Amanda Aston (Marsha Fitzalan), wife of a respected Whitehall official are threatened by the Drew Brothers (Ernie Drew by Bernard Kay).
*Lady Marcia Mary Josephine Fitzalan-Howard (born 10 March 1953), better known as the actress Marsha Fitzalan, married Patrick Ryecart (marriage dissolved); has issue.
Balfour is a niece of British broadcaster and TV presenter Sir David Frost and also a niece of television and stage actress Marsha Fitzalan.

He was married to English actress Marsha Fitzalan, the third daughter of the late 17th Duke of Norfolk, from 4 July 1977 until their divorce in 1995. The couple met at drama school, The Webber Douglas Academy.  They have three grown up children: Mariella Celia (born 1982), Jemima Carrie (born 1984), and Frederick William Hamlet (born 1987). The two elder children are both married. Ryecart lives in London.

Lady Marcia Fitzalan-Howard (b. 1953), daughter of the 17th Duke of Norfolk, uses the stage name Marsha Fitzalan as an actress.
* Marsha Fitzalan (born 1953) (born in Bonn, West Germany)

*Ann Mary Teresa Constable Maxwell (30 August 1927 – 8 April 2013)); married The Honourable Miles Fitzalan-Howard (1915–2002) who became the 17th Duke of Norfolk in 1975, had five children, including the 18th Duke of Norfolk and actress Marsha Fitzalan.
